title: High-Performance Computing
desc: High-performance computing (HPC) is the ability to process data and perform complex calculations at high speeds. HPC is one of the most essential tools fueling the advancement of computational science.

carousel.title: NVIDIA Joins Key Contributors in a National AI Research Resource Pilot
carousel.desc: The U.S. National Science Foundation has launched the National Artificial Intelligence Research Resource pilot, with NVIDIA as a major contributor.

carousel.title: NVIDIA AI Foundry Service
carousel.desc: Businesses can leverage this end-to-end solution for creating custom generative AI models to power enterprise applications.

carousel.title: NVIDIA Announces Earth-2 for Weather Prediction
carousel.desc: Providing a path to simulate and visualize the global atmosphere at unprecedented speed and scale.

carousel.title: Announcing New System for Accelerated Quantum-Classical Computing
carousel.desc: NVIDIA and Quantum Machines debut DGX Quantum-integrated architecture, using open-source CUDA Quantum software platform.

carousel.title: The NVIDIA Framework for HPC
carousel.desc: A new e-book shares best practices for system design, current trends, and expert insights.

carousel.title: Solving HPC Problems at the Edge
carousel.desc: NVIDIA Clara™ Holoscan, BlueField® DPUs, and MetroX®-3 enable streaming processing at the edge.

carousel.title: Bringing Digital Twin Simulation to HPC Data Center Operators
carousel.desc: NVIDIA Omniverse™ lets designers, builders, and operators leverage the power of virtual worlds.

carousel.title: Creating the Earth’s Digital Twin to Understand Climate Change
carousel.desc: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration has selected Lockheed Martin and NVIDIA.
